title: The Shoes are (not?) a Metaphor
body: Growing up, shoes went bad. They became dirty from splashing in places I knew I'd get in trouble for. And I think they make them differently now, because I
swear shoes used to shrink. It seems like they were tiny, dirty and useless within a few months. But now, I have some old shoes. I have shoes that have seen
nearly as many places as I have. I guess they stopped getting dirty the same time they stopped shrinking and the world started to. Sometimes it seems there is
just not enough space to wear out shoes anymore.
